snippet: Advocates of change say former spouses are better able to support themselves these days, while opponents point to continuing needs and judicial discretion.
abstract: Florida joins a grass-roots movement in a growing number of states that seeks to rewrite alimony laws by curbing lifelong alimony and alleviating the financial distress that some payers--still mostly men--say they face; advocates of change say former spouses are better able to support themselves these days, while opponents point to continuing needs and judicial discretion.
lead_paragraph: Advocates of change say former spouses are better able to support themselves these days, while opponents point to continuing needs and judicial discretion.

headline.seo: Alimony Payers Prod States to Update Divorce Laws
headline.main: In Age of Dual Incomes, Alimony Payers Prod States to Update Laws
